reviewText:
Great old school shooter with running gun ablazing. Trade the subtlety of modern FPSs with pure adrenaline rush. No cover, no health recovery, no taking sissy break every 30 seconds.

Beautiful graphics and intense sound design make you feel manly and powerful.

Some dry sense of humor that some might find offensive.

Overall good to pick up and play once a while for pure silly fun.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: Serious Sam in all his glory. The story is decent, the graphics are pretty awesome but more importantly the gameplay is fun. Hordes upon hordes of crazier than crazy enemies running right at you in an attempt to do the impossible: kill Serious Sam. The game is fairly difficult on the default setting, making it a nice challenge. Just get through the first few levels and you'll start seeing the old school shooter that this game really is. The only issue I could mention is the length and perhaps the pacing. The single player campaign takes about 10-12 hours - and the first few hours are very slow, compared to the rest. Playing through the game on different difficulties could make it last longer and there is a survival mode, not to mention multiplayer. It's a solid game altogether, especially if you're a fan of the series. Last but not least...\n\nIt's time to get serious!

reviewText:
A little warning to FPS players used to blazing through FPS games fast- this one takes you off the training wheels and throws you into a serious battlefield!

a few tips from a serious vet:

1. keep moving, just about 99% of the cover in the game is destructible, standing still is a BAD idea.
2. If it shoots bullets, kill it first! in fact, kill anything that has a range advantage over your first, unless it's friggin' kleers, those buggers are annoying.
3. The best targets for C4 are as follows: Khnums, scrapjacks, witch-brides, major biomechanoids.
4. firing off a few rockets and switching to the minigun or assault rifle is a surprisingly  good strategy.
5. above all costs, shoot kamikazes first, you'll live to shoot that scrapjack trying to  reduce you to giblets.
6. Be Prepared to die... a lot.

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3 takes the classic fast paced action and frantic gun selection of the early 90s and adds some nice spice from newer mechanics introduced in the modern day FPS genre.

Often I found myself wrecklessly attacking my foes as death lingered just around the corner. Vast and expansive areas filled with hundreds of enemies swarming at me. Serious Sam is not only a tight shooter, but one that has some of the most impressive battles.

What makes Serious Sam really work is the ability to truly fine tune your experience. You can make co-op a rather enjoyable and hiliarious shooter, or you can make it competitive and difficult, the choice is yours.

Dying WILL happen. This game can be out right sinister with the tricks and situations it puts you in, and only your skills and smart thinking will get you through.

However as great fun as that all is, what brings the game down is really itself. I found that often times killing enemies can get REALLY tedious and breaks are something of a must when looking to complete the game.

Single player is also dull without anyone to experience the ridiculous traps and cheesy jokes and B movie dialogue.

Multiplayer (Not Co-op) just feels a bit tacked on and really doesn't encompass what makes Sam, well, Sam. It can be fun for an hour or so, but I would really only play it to duke it out with some friends on a rare occasion.

Also, the last level is absolutely BRUTAL, and I can't imagine doing it without infinite lives and a partner. Definitely my most fond memory of the game.



Liked:
- Fast
- Action packed
- Co-op galore


Disliked:
- Repetitive



Overall, what Sam 3 does is fun. It might not be perfect and often times dull, but when you get the chance for this game to shine it can really blow you away. One of my favorite Co-op games, and something I would recommend to anyone that has just a close friend, or even up to 16 cool dudes. 7/10

reviewText:
Very fun game, worth whatever you can catch it on sale for! Nice graphics and awesome retro-shooter styled gameplay.
Framerate is all over the place. Going from 30 to 60 isn't really uncommon throughout the game. Uncommon would be maintaining a consistent framerate, but if you set the graphics options correctly, you won't notice anything, other than the already pretty obvious blood and gore.
Nothing really sets the game back other than it's 40€ normal price tag, and the lack of versus servers with a decent ping, though the latter isn't much of an issue because the game is made more for co-op anyway.
Overall, much like the predecessors, there isn't much that can top Serious Sam 3 for balls to the wall shooting fun out there, so if you want to play a game with a bunch of friends and don't wanna think to much, this is a great option right here.

Also,

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh....

reviewText: Coming from my FAVORITE videogame series of all time! Serious Sam 3: BFE shows me a different perspective of how this was all started. The mechanics are fairly the same as for the others in the official series campaign (excluding the indie games) just run, gun, blow up, and basically 'shoot everything that moves!' Along with the (not entirely rspected) modernized mechanics for sprinting, which is extremely helpful in some cases of survivalbility. Aiming sights, which is kind of dumb having to do that because the original games had their guns automatically pinpoint accurate. And the melee which is a nice touch for me, giving more killing varieties. The levels for this game are MASSIVE and have secrets scattered about everywhere, but I am not going to complain how people think the level designs are 'linear.' Just to note that the classic games had linearity of their own perspective, but not big. The music ambience is really soothing, battle music fits my tastes, and boss music gives a big sense of adrenaline for me. The artstyle for me is decent, I do enjoy its 'semi-realism' approach; but I go for the classic's artstyle which had more cartoonish aspects to it. The weapons are still as devastating as ever. The enemy count is HUGE and there are some new variety of enemies now, though not much more, but some. The DLC (Jewel of the Nile) topped the icing, bringing what fans more wanted.\nMy overall verdict: Buy it!

reviewText:
You liked the first Serious Sam? Yes? Then get this one (or at least think about buying when it's on sale). Great old-school-shooter. Countless enemies to kill, wave after wave, it won't stop, your trigger-finger will hurt, your eyes will bleed, you will get stomped, shot down, get blown away by your own C4, get lasered, get kicked away by alien cows, you will surf alien cows, will kill nude witches and harpys and finally, you'll find the cannon gun and make the earth crumble. Starts off kind of slow with some rather ugly levels but then transforms into the old fun we once knew from the first part of the series: beautiful, vast desert areas full of primitive, mindless shooting (and egyptian monuments to destroy). But don't let the word 'primitive' fool you. The game can be quite challenging in some parts and on harder difficulty, at least some tactical approach is needed, especially when playing alone. Of course, one of the greatest aspects of Serious Sam was and still is the Co-Op. The more the merrier! Deathmatch and other PvP is also fun, but hard to find nowadays and nothing you can/should play competitive. All in all, serious fun!

PRO
beautiful desert areas
great number of enemies at once
old-school shooter gameplay
great co-op game
good replay value due to extra modes (survival etc.) and challenging difficulties
CON
it has a story and cutscenes (no one needed that)
Sams one-liner could be better
some levels (especially the first ones) are not so good

reviewText:
A video game loosely based on Herman Melville's romanticized novella The Whale" or as it's popularly known "Moby ♥♥♥♥".

*SPOILERS AHEAD*

A special operative is dropped into the never ending sea of amber to fight the forces of outer limits evil. This commando is known as Sam and he is deadly serious.

Serious Sam adventures through harsh dunes filled with ungodly creatures neither truly defined as machine nor beast (but both)
recommended:
ripping of their eye(s) and ripping off heads.

All the while a leviathan of the sand rears it's massive head in the background of sam's bloody wake.

This creature is known as "The Sandwhale".

Sam vows to kill this massive creature so that he may place it's amber colored jewel upon his crown. A treasure...a trophy.

Sam defeats literally hundreds of waves of foes with rockets
hoursPlayed: shotguns
voteText: and sexy blue whips...all the while that damned Sandwhale is hauntingly dancing and laughing in his whalish tongue at him on the horizon.\n\nThe Sandwhale screaks it's taunting calls to Sam. Sam can feel it now
helpfulPercent: the time of reckoning is close.\n\nSam finally arrives at his final destination
votesHelpful:
"all lines end here" he thinks to himself as the glorious seas of unfinished glass rumble and the maw of the Earth opens to reveal the dormant creature. A lightning storm approached from the West.

" THE TIME IS NOW! IT BEGINS! " Sam yells as he runs towards the fissure.

But
votesTotal: this creature is nothing of what Sam expected. It featured long spider-like legs that stood like tent poles all around him.\nThere were no naughty bits. It had the body of Putin
votesFunny: The Russian Overlord's chest and arms. Upon this massive body was the head that was equally big and equally dumb...with four million eyes
commentsCount: some of which had crusty goodies (you know
column16: that crap you get in the morning)\n\nFor the first time in his life
column17:
Sam didn't know what to do....He was so focused on the Sandy Mammal that he never prepared for anything bigger. All hope was lost....Earth's only champion would not be enough.

*THE EARTH BEGAN TO QUAKE*

The Sandwhale breached the ground and dove into the unknown beast.

Sam's eyes exploded. Could this be true? The very creature which he was trying to slay...was saving him.

Sam's heart was filled with love and sadness at the same time. "My God" he whispered.

Sam then strapped on a jetpack that randomly spawned and threw steel rods (which also randomly spawned) into the creature.

The angry storm grabbed onto the rods with it's electric tendrils and began to shock the creature to it's bones.

The creature fell to it's spidey knees in defeat.

Sam had won. The Sandwhale had won.

(I forgot to mention that all this time for some reason The Moon has been traveling towards the Earth)


Sam's eyes fell to The Sandwhale.

The Moon slammed into the Earth...and the pure
column18: raw
column19:
and unadulterated heat melded their hearts and bodies together. It was like the heat of a thousand suns.

The Earth was no more.

But their love was so strong they had survived. Only they were no longer they...but one.

"Sam Whale"

THE END

- The greatest love story ever told -


TL:DR; We named the Helicopter with tentacles Kevin Pollak."

reviewText:
This game is a great example of how I like my games, intense and great.
It's not as great as the previous Serious Sam In my opinion but it gets the job done for a modern game unlike most of nowadays video games such as Call of Duty.
Enemies running after you non stop at highest difficulty, what can you ask more?
I'd ask better maps, they're not bad but they don't have the feel of Serious Sam nor Serious Sam 2.
The game is really good,  I must admit that at first, I was unsure about this game, I would probably have gave it a 6/10 but now I know that it deserves much more than that so that's why I finally decided to give this game a review.
If you like fast paced shooter where horde of enemies will attack you then you will like this game.

8/10

reviewText: The entire first person shooter genre has become a steaming pile of crap. Plagued by regenerating health, energy shields, power armor, unimaginative weapons, and hiding behind cover. At the very bottom of this pile of crap is a single jem, a jem that shines brightly and will restore your faith in the FPS genre. The Serious Sam series brings back health and armor pickups, big badass weapons and a ton of bullets and rockets to shoot at bazillions of enemies charging, shooting and screaming right at you and ripping your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ wide open if you stand still for more than 5 seconds. That's right, bazillions of enemies. There could be more enemies in one Serious Sam game than there are in the entire Call of Duty franchise put together. If you don't want to get shot, then you better up your strafing game, because you'll be strafing and backpedaling more than you'll be walking forwards. Hope you can hit a moving target son, or you might as well put on your tutu and go back to ballet class if you can't handle the amount of screaming madness this game is throwing at you from all directions.\n\n10/10 Papa DOOM would be proud.

reviewText: Another late review - I prefer the older Serious Sam games, but that may just be out of nostalgia. This game isn't bad though. In fact, it is far from that in my opinion. It stays true to the Serious Sam series and doesn't alter the main gameplay mechanics. Only things new are the option to reload and the addition of melee attacks, both of which I am cool with. Very difficult though, even on its Tourist difficulty. I recommend it if you're a diehard Serious Sam fan, otherwise you may find it kinda meh. But that's just my own assumption.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Serious Sam afficionados would expect from a Serious Sam game to be about big open arenas with hundred of enemies spawning in it and a lot of big weapons to counter that. After all, the tutorial of Serious sam 1 had more than 500 enemies in it.

Well, for the first 4 levels, this game doesn't deliver that. Instead, we're in cluttered city, with small weapons, and very few enemies (about 150-200 per level). It seems like the developpers wanted to introduce the world of Serious Sam slowly for people who are more used to modern games such as Call of Duty. It does deliver some hard fights because you don't have many weapons, but it's not that fun after a while

However, if you manage to get over that first phase, you will finally get your rocket launcher at the end of level 4, and your first big arena at the end of level 5. And then, you will finally get the Serious Sam game you were looking for. The big arenas are back, with tons of ammo (sometimes even boxes of infinite ammo) for you to be able to use the biggest and most badass weapons without a second thought. Waves of enemies will come, and you will mercilessly mow them down.

More over, that second part of the game is cleverly designed. Instead of just being endless slaughter after endless slaughter, the game manages to provide some variety. For example, it will often alternate between the big open arenas where you can be as badass as you want, and some underground, claustrophobic corridors, where the limited vision offered by your flashlight will make you a prey. There are also others set pieces that I will not spoil for you. Suffice to say that once the game finally start rolling, it's hard to put down, it does a lot of stuff very well, up to the final level, which is utterly insane, and a great conclusion to the game.

On the technical side, the Serious Sam 3 engine is extremely impressive, it manages to have dozens of enemies on the screen at the time, while looking gorgeous, and also have destructible terrain. If you or one of the enemy uses rockets, or C4, you will be able to blow up almost any obstacle, for example to remove the cover of an enemy, or to help give you a better line of sight on far away enemies.

Finally, I want to give a mentions to the soundtrack which is fantastic, and accompagnies the game extremely well. Big thumbs up for that.

So my final word is easy : buy this game, get over the first four levels even if you're not that happy with them, and you will be rewarded by a great game of utter mayhem and joyous use of rocket launcher.

reviewText:
Great old school shooter with running gun ablazing. Trade the subtlety of modern FPSs with pure adrenaline rush. No cover, no health recovery, no taking sissy break every 30 seconds.

Beautiful graphics and intense sound design make you feel manly and powerful.

Some dry sense of humor that some might find offensive.

reviewText: Serious Sam in all his glory. The story is decent, the graphics are pretty awesome but more importantly the gameplay is fun. Hordes upon hordes of crazier than crazy enemies running right at you in an attempt to do the impossible: kill Serious Sam. The game is fairly difficult on the default setting, making it a nice challenge. Just get through the first few levels and you'll start seeing the old school shooter that this game really is. The only issue I could mention is the length and perhaps the pacing. The single player campaign takes about 10-12 hours - and the first few hours are very slow, compared to the rest. Playing through the game on different difficulties could make it last longer and there is a survival mode, not to mention multiplayer. It's a solid game altogether, especially if you're a fan of the series. Last but not least...\n\nIt's time to get serious!

reviewText:
A fun lighthearted game. Reminded me of the old DukeNukem style of game. I was stuck in the first mission thinking if I killed everything they would stop coming and that I would just walk to the objective. Wrong! I am in two minds whether this is a good or bad thing as you get rated at the end of the mission how many kills, how many secrets and how long you take. Well you can keep killing guys and take forever and get a crap score or you can run to the objective not worrying to much about the aliens and get a decent score. Not quite balance in that regard.
An ejoyable game. If you can grab for under $5 its a great deal.
6.5/10

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3: BFE takes places before the events of Serious Sam 1 First Encounter and Second Encounter. The game sticks to it's roots which is a mindless shoot'em up arena shooter. Shoot all the enemies, to move on. Lots of loot to be found and secrets to be explored. The game is not too closely related to Serious Sam 2.  GREAT co-op game.

No graphical issues for me.
Multiplayer is a bit bare, which is a shame it's lot of fun.
Difficulty is a wide range, not on ly do you have something like 5-7 difficulty settings, you can tweak the difficulty and make it even harder in co-op.

Similar Games: Painkiller.
If you like SS3 make sure to check out the rest of the series.
Has tools for you to make your own content

reviewText:
How to play Serious Sam:
1:Start the game
2:Start the campaign
3:Laugh at the horrendous cutscene
4:Lower your expectations
5:Start playing the first level
6:Finish
7:Get to second level
8:Get swarmed by thousands of enemies, and shoot. ♥♥♥♥ing. Everything
9:Realize that this is actually really fun
10:Spend the next 10 hours beating the game
11:Try to play multiplayer after you beat the game
12:Realize Multiplayer sucks, and that yous should play single player again
13:Repeat

reviewText:
Сэм вернулся... я ждал его возвращение очень долгое время... и наконец 3 часть игры про похождение крутого сема вышла в свет... Никаких укрытий, огромное количество врагов, черный юмор, брутальность главного героя... все доведено до совершенства... Для тех кто уже играл в предыдущие части это весьма хорошее, веселое, брутальное истребление прищельецев под хорошую музыку... Все как фанаты любят...
Если вы не играли в эту линейку игр, это вам не call of duty и battlefild где вы сделали 3-4 выстрела, вас ранили, сели, посрали, востановили здоровье пока ваши Боты расчистят територия и идете дальше и так всю игру... Здесь придеться ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ бегу... Нет это не враги кричат убегаю от вас... Расслабились? хрен вам это камикадзе штук 60 и чем ближе кричат тем хуже для вас... Нет враги не останавливаються что бы отдохнуть или ещё что ни будь... вы ОДИН!!! А ИХ ПОЛ ВСЕЛЕННОЙ!!! Вперед с Боем

reviewText: Most of the things they've introduced anew are kind of bad, like weapon reloading, and sprinting while unable to use your weapon, rather than Sam just running that fast all the time. Melee kills are kind of neat once, but you just don't have time for them by the point the game has ramped up to a proper Serious level.\n\nIt doesn't matter. It's still Sam. Soon the trappings of more modern shooters fall away and leave you with the familiar old tools, weaving your way through a herd of Kleer while trying to deal with the approaching gigantic horror before it steps on you. It doesn't really progress the series in any way but graphically (the plot has gone backwards again), but it can get away with being another iteration of the solid fast-and-fluid FPS and leave you grinning from the adrenaline.

reviewText: Ну, я ждал эту игру 6 лет и вот что разработчики преподнесли.Хотелось бы начать с графики. Её как я и ожидал улучшили, но одно меня огорчило. Движок Serious Engine 3.5 абсолютно кривой и его кривизна заметна. На моменте когда Сэм вырывает глаз гнаару хочется плакать, вид от 3го лица вообще лучше не включать. Если уж делать игру с кооперативом, то надо ж его до ума довести. Смотреть как твой партнёр держит оружие ладошками просто смешно и на то как Сэм передвигается сидя без слёз не взглянешь. Ну если откинуть движок и все его недочёты, то игра получилась очень крутой хоть непродолжительной, всего около 3-6 часов. Разработчикам удалось сохранить ту атмосферу которая была в предыдущих двух частях, когда на тебя бежит толпа разгневанных пришельцев и тебе ничего не остаётся, кроме того чтобы взять миниган и всех их похоронить.Саунтрэк просто сногшибательный, куча новых врагов, куча нового оружия, кооператив на 16 человек, все теже коронные фразочки Сэма, всё это подарило незабываемое удовольствие от игры.Конечно же игра не стоит своих 600 рублей, но на распрадаже по скидкам взять и поиграть с друзьями просто необходимо! Вобщем оценка моя такова 9.7 было бы 10 если бы движок доработали,а так игра крутая всем советую.

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3 takes the classic fast paced action and frantic gun selection of the early 90s and adds some nice spice from newer mechanics introduced in the modern day FPS genre.

Often I found myself wrecklessly attacking my foes as death lingered just around the corner. Vast and expansive areas filled with hundreds of enemies swarming at me. Serious Sam is not only a tight shooter, but one that has some of the most impressive battles.

What makes Serious Sam really work is the ability to truly fine tune your experience. You can make co-op a rather enjoyable and hiliarious shooter, or you can make it competitive and difficult, the choice is yours.

Dying WILL happen. This game can be out right sinister with the tricks and situations it puts you in, and only your skills and smart thinking will get you through.

However as great fun as that all is, what brings the game down is really itself. I found that often times killing enemies can get REALLY tedious and breaks are something of a must when looking to complete the game.

Single player is also dull without anyone to experience the ridiculous traps and cheesy jokes and B movie dialogue.

Multiplayer (Not Co-op) just feels a bit tacked on and really doesn't encompass what makes Sam, well, Sam. It can be fun for an hour or so, but I would really only play it to duke it out with some friends on a rare occasion.

Also, the last level is absolutely BRUTAL, and I can't imagine doing it without infinite lives and a partner. Definitely my most fond memory of the game.



Liked:
- Fast
- Action packed
- Co-op galore


Disliked:
- Repetitive



Overall, what Sam 3 does is fun. It might not be perfect and often times dull, but when you get the chance for this game to shine it can really blow you away. One of my favorite Co-op games, and something I would recommend to anyone that has just a close friend, or even up to 16 cool dudes. 7/10

reviewText: It's a great old school fps. Back from a time where men were men and didn't need to hide behind tables because they got shot twice in the chest. No, this is a game for men who don't jump behind cover in the face of danger.  A game for men who like dismembering aliens with their bare hands and using the body parts to decorate Christmas trees. A game for men who switch to miniguns if they run out of ammo, not pistols. A game for men who go into battle wearing T-shirts instead of body amor. A game for men who like killing their foes with baseball bats instead of puny knives. A game for men. So play this game...IF YOU'VE GOT THE ♥♥♥♥ING BALLS.

reviewText:
Eye Strain
Headaches
Neck pains
Back Pains
Numbness of the Fingers
Wrist Numbness
Absolute hatred for anything that moves
Enhanced reflexes

If you experience any of the following symptoms while playing...It only means you're playing it right.

Pros-
-Guns have excellent punch
-Enemies have tweaks
-New enemies are fun
-Boss fights are well done
-Soundtrack is bad*ss

Cons-
-First few levels set in Cairo are very dull (Modern Military-ish)
-The new Soldier enemy feels really out of place
-Everytime you(or an enemy) causes an explosion, the AoE gets filled with
dust that obscures your vision
-Whenever you take damage the screens blurs, now imagine that from CONSTANT
enemy fire

Overall, still a better game than most modern shooters.
Protip- Play in Hard Difficulty
9/10

reviewText:
This game is a great example of how I like my games, intense and great.
It's not as great as the previous Serious Sam In my opinion but it gets the job done for a modern game unlike most of nowadays video games such as Call of Duty.
Enemies running after you non stop at highest difficulty, what can you ask more?

The game is really good,  I must admit that at first, I was unsure about this game, I would probably have gave it a 6/10 but now I know that it deserves much more than that so that's why I finally decided to give this game a review.
If you like fast paced shooter where horde of enemies will attack you then you will like this game.

8/10

reviewText: Probably one of the best Serious Sam games in the series in my opinion. The sprint option in the game is great for dodging those kamikazes and kleers left and right. The melee option now makes the game even more gory than it used to be. Aim down sights is kind of cool, but somewhat useless since it just slows you down and only increases accuracy by a small percentage. It would be nice if the lasergun wasn't an easter egg and was an actual gun that was meant to be used ingame. Same thing with the sniper. Two of my favorite weapons from the old games aside from the minigun and cannon. Another note, this is possibly one of the only Serious Sam games without the serious bomb to nuke enemies, but the game makes up for it with the new features to help you with escaping and retreating to ammo and armor. All in all, my favorite game in the series and can't wait for the next installment where we get to possibly see Mental's ugly face.

reviewText: The entire first person shooter genre has become a steaming pile of crap. Plagued by regenerating health, energy shields, power armor, unimaginative weapons, and hiding behind cover. At the very bottom of this pile of crap is a single jem, a jem that shines brightly and will restore your faith in the FPS genre. The Serious Sam series brings back health and armor pickups, big badass weapons and a ton of bullets and rockets to shoot at bazillions of enemies charging, shooting and screaming right at you and ripping your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ wide open if you stand still for more than 5 seconds. That's right, bazillions of enemies. There could be more enemies in one Serious Sam game than there are in the entire Call of Duty franchise put together. If you don't want to get shot, then you better up your strafing game, because you'll be strafing and backpedaling more than you'll be walking forwards. Hope you can hit a moving target son, or you might as well put on your tutu and go back to ballet class if you can't handle the amount of screaming madness this game is throwing at you from all directions.\n\n10/10 Papa DOOM would be proud.

reviewText: Another late review - I prefer the older Serious Sam games, but that may just be out of nostalgia. This game isn't bad though. In fact, it is far from that in my opinion. It stays true to the Serious Sam series and doesn't alter the main gameplay mechanics. Only things new are the option to reload and the addition of melee attacks, both of which I am cool with. Very difficult though, even on its Tourist difficulty. I recommend it if you're a diehard Serious Sam fan, otherwise you may find it kinda meh. But that's just my own assumption.

The game is really good,  I must admit that at first, I was unsure about this game, I would probably have gave it a 6/10 but now I know that it deserves much more than that so that's why I finally decided to give this game a review.
If you like fast paced shooter where horde of enemies will attack you then you will like this game.

8/10

reviewText: I've always been a fan of the old school run-gun-fun style of first-person shooters compared to call of duty or battlefield and Serious Sam 3 BFE is an excellent call-back to that era of gaming. The fastest way to describe it would be to call it the first Serious Sam game wearing the mask of a modern FPS. The level design varies from the ruins of Cairo to ancient Egyptian cities but all feature three main things. Large open ares, massive hordes and big damm guns. Theres quite a bit of variation in enemies and weapons to keep it from getting repetitive but having said this, some enemy attacks can become very annoying, especially when you've just grabbed a minigun are in the zone. Overall, it's a very enjoyable game with some funny dialogue and satisfying gameplay.

reviewText:
I was gifted SS3:BFE by one of my best friends. It is one of the worst games I've ever played, period.

The gameplay is worse than Quake; plot worse than Duke Nuke'em; graphics on par with Tom Clancy's Rainbow 6; the overall experience as mindless and boring as Solitaire--games I disliked for a multitude of reasons, true, but games that have EXCUSES for their bad, dated elements. But in its blatant ripping off of the worst features of tired genres, SS3:BFE can't even claim originality as a saving grace. The only excuse its developers could possibly offer is apathy and laziness.

As a fan of terrible, B-movies, I enjoyed the terribly voiced (by a literal strip-club bouncer), latently homoerotic dialogue immensely; and as a staunch ally of the LGBTQ community, I am glad that this game is targeting the closeted-homosexual demographic. However, the hours one has to spend getting from one ridiculous cut scene to another just aren't worth it--rent 300, Top Gun, or Superbad instead.

reviewText:
All my life I was always fascinated by the battle of thermopoly  when I was ten or eleven I always though now how would that have went if the spartans had a mini gun?

Well If you ever wanted to know the answer to the question look no further.

Tons of choke point battles where one man with a mini gun, and a host of other weapons is pitted against nearly endless hordes.

Well ok that's not completely true the hordes do have an end but it feels like they're unending.

This is a game where it gives you that sense of accomplishment, and teaches you that yes, that wave was hard but the next one is even worse.

Seriously buy this, there's few shooters like this on the market it's well worth the purchase.

reviewText:
Positive:
+ some funny comments from Sam
+ 1 good puzzle

Negative:
- extremely linear
- all the environment throughout the game looks the same, no variation
- easy to get lost in maze-like places with not even a minimap or compass to guide you
- all the puzzles follow this logic: find a key or a lever from a vast arena filled with ruins to open the next damned door.
- poor choice of weapons

Verdict:

Overall the game feels tired and stands out with it's lack of creativity. It's lack of modern day features creates an impression as if it was designed back in '93, in the days when 3D shooting games were a new thing.  Total waste of time.

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3 BFE is actually a prequel of the previous Serious Sam games, with BFE meaning Before First Encounter. You’ll see a lot of similarities between the main character Sam Stone, and Duke Nukem, the other super macho hero from around the same gaming era. The games are quite different though. Where Duke Nukem Forever (the latest Duke game) tried to model itself as a modern shooter, Serious Sam 3 sticks to its roots of being a You vs 10000 enemies type horde shooter. Each enemy has just enough life that you need to focus your fire on them as a hundred others come running at you. You’ll spend a lot of the game running backwards as you lay down the fire.

Unlike the previous Serious Sam games (First Encounter, Second Encounter, Serious Sam 2) BFE takes place in the future. Unfortunately, in this future the Earth has been overrun by aliens and the whole game occurs in devastated cities and ancient Egyptian ruins. Serious Sam 3’s story is mostly about how Sam needs to activate and use an ancient Sirian (alien) device called the Time Lock, which will allow him to go back in time and prevent the alien invasion.  There isn’t really a primary antagonist for the game, although Sam’s old enemy Mental (the boss in previous games) is mentioned as being the leader of the aliens.

BFE is an old school first person shooter with loads of health/ammo pickups, loads of enemies, and a bunch of big ♥♥♥ bosses to fight. The sheer number of enemies practically guarantees that you take damage in every engagement, but there’s so much health and armor laying around that the game is a huge survival match.  This is one of those games where I would actually recommend people to play on one of the easier difficulties the first time through. There’s a lot of stress relief to be found in blowing up hundreds of enemies with a wide assortment of weapons. Get used to holding down the trigger button as you back up and sidestep enemies charging after you.

The game also has a ton of secrets to find, generally health/ammo/weapons. These are the old school secrets where you actually have to look for them by climbing over walls or busting through barricades. In a lot of modern games the secrets are just out of the way like in a dead end corridor or under a staircase. This is not the case in Serious Sam 3. You can play through this whole game and only find about 5 out of 100+ secrets unless you know what you’re looking for.

Pros:
+While the story is forgettable, the game has pretty nice graphics with a bunch of weapons to choose from. The thousands of enemies you face means that you’re going to really in the action most of the time.
+There actually seem to still be multiplayer servers running. The game’s co-op mode is pretty fun.
+Giant bosses!

Cons:
-Yes, the game can be brainless at times, but that’s part of its charm . Do note however, that there is some annoying puzzle solving to be done in the game. It’s usually about finding keys to locked doors or opening wall panels to get out of underground chambers.
-Even on easy mode the game can be difficult (for impatient people). The difficulty setting doesn’t seem to affect the number of enemies you face, just how much life and damage dealing power they have. Near the end there are sections with infinite rocket launcher ammo and seemingly thousands of enemies rushing you.

Overall, Serious Sam 3 is a fun game, and if you enjoyed the previous ones you’ll like the modern update. If you’ve only played Serious Sam 2, note that part 2 is quite different from the others in the series (more focused on humor). Serious Sam 3 is more focused on big guns mowing down aliens.

reviewText:
While it's a decent enough entry to the series, SS3 feels way too toned down for its own good.  All the color is sucked out of the game, and the too-familiar Egyptian locale gets old almost immediately.  SS1 did Egypt well, with all sorts of vibrant colors going on, but since this is the not-too-distant-future, all that's gone.

Enemies appear in as large of groups as ever, but very poorly staggered so that if you clear out a few dozen, you're left waiting nearly a minute in some cases for the next wave to pop in.  Add in a very small variety for most big waves (soldiers, kamikaze, kleer, kleer, kleer, kleer), music that's nowhere near as exciting as in previous games, and the big waves just get tedious after a very short while.

The new enemies they brought in don't help much, as most are an exercise in how long you're willing to play hide and seek.  The jumping monkey things aren't particularly threatening but just painfully obnoxious, the telekinetic witches break the flow of a firefight over their weird psychic knees, the technopolips (hey I remembered that one's name) should get a medal for how well they avoid rockets, and the tiny spider dudes are basically just the frogs from SS1, since everyone loved those so much.

For all the advancements 10 or so years have given us, environments don't feel at all improved from the first two games, and the muted color palette only serves to obfuscate the level design.  It's clear enough to figure out where to go, but also pretty easy to get turned around after a particularly long fight.  Dark areas that force a flashlight and slower movement speed on you are dumb and I don't have anything good to say about them.  Egypt Egypt Egypt; it's all been said.  There's nothing exceptionally exciting or pretty or interesting going on; no more lava caves or comically creepy graveyards or secret miniature recreations of the first game's final bossfight.  There are some Sirian places, but you usually turn right around after getting a macguffin, so I wouldn't really say those count.

Secrets in general are very lackluster.  Crollywood sign, big-headed recreations of the design team, giant boxing glove spring trap?  No, but how about a medium health pack?  Sometimes you get lucky and find a laser rifle with almost no ammo, though.

The new weapons are okay, but the Bulletstorm/Metroid-style laser whip thing is really limited in its applications except to get an achievement against one certain new enemy.  The short range and its ability to overheat don't really feel right in a game like this.  The sniper rifle rocket launcher thing is fun, and makes the aforementioned kleer infestations a breeze.  But seriously, a generic M4 over a Tommy gun?  Not even touching the reloading thing, but that's just lame.  Sledgehammer was cool but the melee execution moves served the same purpose and let you teleport thirty feet at a time.  Chainsaw again plz.

There are still lots of guns, there are still lots of things to shoot with those guns, there's still fun to be had.  Maybe it's a bit different that before, but it's not all bad.  It's just a bit different.  ...Usually in kind of annoying ways.  Whatever!  It's definitely fun enough, and if the HD remakes of SS1 aren't doing it for you anymore, this is a reasonable enough choice.  But maybe consider bringing a friend along to have someone to talk to while you traipse through Egypt once again.

reviewText:
This game reminds me so much of the online MonsterHunt in the first Unreal Tournament (NOT Invasion in UT2004). The game doesn't send enemies at you in waves in arenas. No, you have to keep pushing and pushing further on the map through the enemies.

Luckily, there are often places where you can take a break too. And you will want to. The fights in this game are incredibly intense. I simply had to just stop and take some deep breaths and relax abit. You find a minigun and never stop firing it for like 5 minutes, because the game just keeps throwing them at you, while you dodge chained cannonballs.

The jokes could be better. I discovered this game when I played Shadow Warrior. I heard he's kinda like Duke, so I expected him to be funnier.

Do be careful when playing this game for longer sessions. Dodging the rain of projectiles requires a lot of concentration and may cause headache withtin 1-2 hours.

8/10 would spread democracy at 3000 freedoms per minute again.

reviewText:
This is THE game for Plumbers.

By Plumbers I mean of course, Bad Alien/Monster/Demon Eradicating badasses. The jokes usually aren't half bad and there isn't enough adult material to make you puke, only enough to be suggestive. The enemy designs are actually kinda thought provoking. x)

For instance, why does that bird lady have boobs? Can it really be just to lure prey? Does that mean it looked at a certain type of woman for a really long time, and it morphed via evolution to look like that woman?

Why are men it's only prey? <;/

This game makes me feel like some kind of super plumber!

Thumbs up! :D

Oh, and one more thing. It's a crazy game but, the enemies aren't usually fans of tact.

Not so much that they're predictable, but...

I mean, you'll get what I mean when you fight the Kamikaze fighters.

And one more thing. Atleast 99 percent of this game is in Egypt/Cairo. I haven't seen it take place anywhere else yet.

reviewText: The feel of the game is so similar  to the original, with all of the elements that you'd expect of  a Serious Sam game that I immediately felt at home; but with SS3  we get   even better looking, and in some cases,  scarier  looking monsters and  realistic looking weapons as well as fabulous  environments to run and gun around in.\n\nIf you ever played the first two episodes when they were originally released   and  enjoyed the games because of the tongue in cheek violence, the various ways you could  change the look of the game to show gore,  hippie flower power or a child-like   expression of  blood as well as an over the top hero and waves of monsters, then you won't be  disappointed with  this new offering.  I've been waiting for SS3 to be released for years and am NOT disappointed with the result.  Croteam  have excelled.  There are so many great games being released at the moment, but for  pure unadulterated fun  this is one of the better releases over the last four or five months

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3: BFE is a shooter unlike no other. This was made before shooters were expected to be realistic, this is aimed at straight up crazy fun madness. It combines FPS with over the top gore and hordes of enemies (like 200 at a time). The story is ok but sadly ends on a cliff hanger. There are also heaps of secrets to find around the huge levels from laserguns to secret chambers. Multiplayer contains two options, versus and Co-op. Versus is about DM, TDM, CTF and many more. Co-Op is really where this game shines for me. The game is best played with one or more friends. The over the the top alien killing madness is alot more enjoyable in a group. Oh, and the soundtrack is great, really sets the atmosphere.

There is also a moddable version of the game for workshop compadibility and downloaded mods. (Be warned, workshop items may not always work untill steam or computer is rebooted)

Needs Serious Sam 4! SERIOUSLY!(So funny) Or something to sooth the pain of the cliff hanger story.

BIG GUNS, BIG BUGS, BIG FUN!

But seriously, buy the game.

reviewText: Wanted to play this for a long time and finally bought it. I've been a huge fan of Serious Sam games for a long time, and have played First and Second Encounters to death (can't say the same about SS 2, but I'll tend to that in the nearest future). So far I have completed about half of the game, and I really like it. The first few levels were quite slow paced and felt a bit different from previous Serious Sam installments, but eventually the pace picks up and it plays just like the classics. The tone of the game is more serious, with more realistic weapon and enemy models, but it's not a bad thing. Overall, Serious Sam 3 is a worth a play for an ordinary FPS fan, and a must buy for seasoned Serious Sam players.

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3: BFE - The BFE stands for Before First Encounter, which makes this a prequel to the other Serious Sam games. The story is a simple but effective one - Aliens invade, lots of nasty critters, turn on and go to the time travel doodad and connect up to First Encounter to save earth. As a bonus, you get an auto-translator if you stare at text that shows you some more backstory and other bits of text.

At first, it seems like Sam has been reduced to a generic military shooter. Instead of the bright and fast shooting from the Sam games before this one there are basic guns, a grey cityscape, and somewhat basic soldiers you need to shoot like just another chest high wall simulating shooter game. But as you progress you find more interesting things to fight, you get more options, you find the old enemies again, and the environment shifts from generic cityscape to more interesting environments. You get more weapons, and the generic soldier enemies are slowly phased out as you get further in. It once again makes shooting fun

With large levels that have plenty of secrets hidden throughout them, exploring is rewarded. There seem to be a few new enemies but I do not think they all worked out that well. Of the ones I do not really like, one is mainly just annoying as it hides from you in what would otherwise be a fast paced game where you can go around avoiding everything through skill and proper manouvring, and the other uses magic to hold you in place in the air while shaking your aim. Luckily, these are not too common and the former can usually be ignored as you do not have to kill them to progress.

As is expected of Sam, there is a good co-op mode that allows you to bring one or several friends with you, and the settings are as detailed as they always were to let you customise your experience. Difficulty is not a problem - Sometimes it may feel like you're up against nearly impossible odds, but with a little bit of skill and a little bit of luck you can get through it.

While I would not say it is as good as First Encounter, it provides a very solid experience with plenty of amusing moments, Serious Sam 3: BFE will give anyone with an interest plenty of enjoyable hours of play - And then even more if they bring a friend

reviewText:
Well... this was a serious disappointment.

I liked previous Serious Sam games. They were (well, still ARE) colorful, fast paced and fun. There's a multitude of enemies to hit, lots of ammo. It's a great way to unwind after a long day (albeit if you're there for a challenge, those games could also deliver).

This time around? I was snoozing for the first number of levels. Then an annoying space monkey" kind of enemy made the experience so annoying I had to take a break. And where are all the cool toys? Why does the game seem to expect the player to find secrets to get the big guns (in previous games secrets were bonuses
date:
you could skip them and still have a blast will all the game had to offer).

I can't help but feel that massive fights seem to have been replaced with smaller skirmishes. Occasional larger battles seem far less "packed" than before.

If you like Serious Sam
recommended: you're better off replaying the old games with your friends. Do not waste your time on this."

reviewText: This, ladies and gentlemen, is how you make a ♥♥♥♥ing shooter! Holy crap! It is harder than the cake your mom made me yesterday, and manlier than eating bacon while fighting a bear. And Sam 'Serious' Stone is the best video-game character since sliced bread (that's how you use that, isn't it?). Anyway, this is no cover, no sissy regenerating health and no new-age leveling system. Those are for losers. It does have near-impossible levels and bosses that will make your toes curl with rage. Beating each level feals like you are the best gamer this world has ever known. And unlike Duke Nukem Forever, this game manages to get back to its roots perfectly and still improve on graphics, cheesy one-liners, story telling, guns, enemies, bosses, style and whatnot. Frankly, until now I tought capturing the spirit of 'old' games like this one was impossible with modern graphics. Turns out I just never saw anybody capable of it. But croteam is. Croteam took the best ♥♥♥♥ing video-game character ever and revived him without permanently damaging his vital functions *cough* Duke Nukem *cough*.  This game has the good ol' HOLY-♥♥♥♥-I-CAN'T-BELIEVE-I-JUST-ACTUALLY-BEAT-THIS-LEVEL-♥♥♥♥-YES feeling, but it never feels unfair. Modern games are either way too easy or way too hard in an unfair way. This is way too hard in a fair way, and because this game is not entirely serious, you'll laugh rather than cry when you hear the spawning sounds of 2000 enemies all around you. The crying comes later. Now the official reviewy score-thingy: 11/10, 6 stars, amazing, would ♥♥♥♥.\n\nAmazing quote: 'Croteam owns!' - Sam Stone.

reviewText:
Serious Sam 3 is everything you've come to expect from the franchise; An arcade, lightning fast, Arena Shooter that doesn't take it self to serious, but, with a twist or two for the better or worse.


The Good
Just like its predecessors, each level is quite impressive in scale, designed from the ground up with the insane arena battles the franchise is known for in mind and the third game does not disappoint in that regard;

On top of that, good old Sam still runs as fast as he did before and the ability to carry and entire arsenal of weapons at once (a total of fifteen) has NOT been taken away.

Now, while linear, there are still many secret areas to be uncovered, as well as classic pick ups, ranging from different types of Ammo, Health Packs, Armour to Keys and/or any other kind of random item necessary to progress through the game.

Pretty standard stuff, that in a way, feels kindda like a breath of fresh air in this day and age.

...now as far as progression and length goes, the game starts up quite slow for a Sam game, but not in an intrusive way like many modern titles do with their pointless scripted events, cutscenes or the like.

Instead, the very first handful of levels are quite open to exploration (though still linear to a certain extent) with some interesting enemy placement, with nothing but a few moments dedicated to the insane Arena Shooting we all know and love; It kinda feels like a prologue" for what's yet to come
recommended: as we progress through the campaign
hoursPlayed: the game quickly goes back to its roots
voteText: and boy is this a long game!\n\nThe Single-Player campaign alone toke me over 20 hours to complete

reviewText:
This game is an absolute blast to play.  The game looks stunning even when using low settings.  The only bad point about the game is that the shotgun sounds way to weak.

Get this game! Seriously ..... GET IT!

It can even run on a mobile processor so it should work well on a large variety of system specifications, however if you don't like the default you customise EVERY graphical setting and I mean everything, so there's a lot of mixing and matching settings which is brilliant.

Keep in mind that if your looking for a typical COD clone then this game ins't for you.  It's combining new with old here.  Its more of an old school shooter.

Killing enemies is also very satisfying, and you can even tear off heads, hearts and even eyes off enemies and throw them at other enemies.

The game even has a seprate Moddable version that you get when buying the game, allowing you to use a whole wealth of workshop content to add new maps, enemies, game modes, weapons and more for free, but if you want to keep the game mod free you can also play the standard version which doesn't support mods.

It also features full controller support right from the get go, which means this game works amazingly well with big picture mode or SteamOS.  And ..... it also has .... splitscreen .... seriously (no pun intended) which is rare for a PC game, which makes it even better that this game has controller support.

I honestly cannot recommend this game enough, its well worth the price.

reviewText:
Great and fun sequel, but IMO the worst of the series. And what does that mean for the average player ? Nothing, because the older games in the series are so great I doubt it can get better than that. This one is just a bit less great. Most of the things I missed in this game were fixed in the Jewel Of The Nile maps.

Positives:
- great graphics
- blood and gore
- insanely huge maps
- good soundtrack as always
- multiple boss fights

Negatives:
- can't compete with the greatness of The Second Encounter
- modern Egypt doesn't look as great as ancient Egypt
- they went too far with smoke, dust and debries
- lack of use of harpies and sniper oriented battles (fixed in JOTN)

So, basically the only negative thing about it is that older titles were too good :P
